Hellplague:
 
The femme continued to watch, it was entertaining to see him work.  She hoped soon he would be finished, she had to check the computer to make sure it could work for what she needed it for.  Brainwashing Malice was no easy task, and undoing that programming will be just as hard.

Alex Sell <kraftlos@...> wrote:
"I have a lot of expirence with this sort of stuff.  Especially since
I have been surviving with these salvage skills for the past few
megacycles...."  he said continuing to piece together some pieces of
junk he found on the floor in the next room over.  He pulled out some
of his own tools: a saudering iron and a few clamps to hold stuff in
place, and continued his work.


On Sun, 17 Oct 2004 16:01:23 -0700 (PDT), robert riley
<bustercross365@...> wrote:
> 
> OOC:  That computer is the hub, the core processing computer.  There are a
> few other computers which are operational, but require the hub in order to
> grant full access.  Navagation, Library and Logs, Sensors, Engines, Internal
> systems, and Communications all connect to the Core Prossessing computer. 
> Fix the CPC, and you will restore all the computer systems.
>  
> Hellplague:
>  
> "How do you know how to build componants and repair that computer?  It's
> amazing work.  I have never seen someone pretty much build a computer from
> sratch.  How do you do it?" the femme asked as Celeron worked on the damaged
> computer.
> SHe sat in a corner and reclined back, finding it interesting to watch the
> bot work.
> 
> Alex Sell <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> 
> 
> After about an hour Celeron finished rewiring the power supply using
> parts from the fried one and scraps of wiring that for some reason
> were lieing around.  He then threw the broken pieces into an area that
> he would designate as his junk pile.  After a quick examination, he
> realized that the computer could be turned on (though it would not be
> able to be used yet as he hadn't build any networking parts or
> replaced the other 2 interface cards).  But he was pleasently suprised
> to find that all the software was still intact).  He turned if off,
> then when out into the ship again looking for more parts.
> 
> OOC: Is this computer the ship's main computer?
> 
> 
> 
> "NOW... YOU'RE FINISHED! FINAL... FLASH!"
>
